overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence on multiple social media platforms, with a total of 3,580 followers across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky. His posts engage a diverse audience with topics focused on social media research and computational methods, resulting in a strong and varied engagement across platforms.

contentThemes.description: Posts discussing research projects, grants, and papers related to social media analysis and information operations.
Announcements and opportunities for hiring researchers and postdoctoral positions in computational social science.
Engagements related to presenting at conferences and participating in discussions about disinformation.

recommendations: Increase the frequency of posts related to research findings and conference presentations, as they tend to have higher engagement.
Engage more with followers by encouraging discussions and comments on posts, particularly on Bluesky and Mastodon.

platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon posts have moderate engagement; increasing interactions with followers might boost engagement.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn posts receive the highest engagement, likely due to the professional audience interested in research and career opportunities.

topPerformingContent.content: Excited to announce that our research team has been awarded a new grant to study information operations across social media platforms.
Just published our new paper on coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media platforms!
